description: Negotiation is the art and the science of creating good agreements. This course develops managerial negotiation skills by mixing lectures and practice, using cases and exercises in which students negotiate with each other. The cases cover a wide range of problems and settings: one-shot deals between individuals, repeated negotiations, negotiations over several issues, negotiations among several parties (both within and between organizations), and cross-cultural issues. Performance in the cases accounts for nearly half the course grade. Students must also describe their experience and thoughts in a journal, and write a term paper.
name: NEGOTIATIONS

values.comments:
OPIM 291 develops managerial negotiation skills by mixing lectures and practice, using cases and exercises in which students negotiate with each other. The cases cover a wide range of problems and settings: one-shot deals between individuals, repeated negotiations, negotiations over several issues, negotiations among several parties (both within and between organizations), and cross-cultural issues. Performance in the cases accounts for nearly half the course grade. Students must also describe their experience and thoughts in a journal, and write a term paper.

Students thoroughly enjoyed OPIM291402 taught by Professor Hershey. The material, students noted, was very applicable to real-world situations, with one student proclaiming that the class was “one of the most enlightening classes [he had] taken at Penn.”

Students praised Professor Hershey, describing him as “absolutely fantastic,” “extremely knowledgeable,” and able to “spark genuine interest” from the students. As well, students noted his exceptional accessibility.

While there was some frustration over the heavy weighting of the final exam and presentation for the overall grade, most students seemed satisfied with the grading of the class. 

Note: 8 written reviews
